workflow.name: Automated product health monitor with anomaly detection & AI root cause analysis
workflow.description:
## Description

This workflow transforms raw SaaS metrics into a fully automated Product Health Monitoring & Incident Management system.

It checks key revenue and usage metrics every day (such as churn MRR and feature adoption), detects anomalies using a statistical baseline, and automatically creates structured incidents when something unusual happens.

When an anomaly is found, the workflow logs it into a central incident database, alerts the product team on Slack and by email, enriches the incident with context and AI-generated root-cause analysis, and produces a daily health report for leadership.

It helps teams move from passive dashboard monitoring to a proactive, automated system that surfaces real issues with clear explanations and recommended next steps.

## Context

Most SaaS teams struggle with consistent product health monitoring:

- Metrics live in dashboards that people rarely check proactively

- Spikes in churn or drops in usage are noticed days later

- There is no unified system to track, investigate, and report on incidents

- Post-mortems rely on memory rather than structured data

- Leadership often receives anecdotal updates instead of reliable daily reporting

This workflow solves that by:

- Tracking core health metrics daily (revenue and usage)

- Detecting anomalies based on recent baselines, not arbitrary thresholds

- Logging all incidents in a consistent format

- Notifying teams only when action is needed

- Generating automated root-cause insights using AI + underlying database context

- Producing a daily ‚ÄúProduct Health Report‚Äù for decision-makers

The result:

Faster detection, clearer understanding, and better communication across product, growth, and leadership teams.

## Target Users

This template is ideal for:

- Product Managers & Product Owners

- SaaS founders and early-stage teams

- Growth, Analytics, and Revenue Ops teams

- PMO / Operations teams managing product performance

Any organization wanting a lightweight incident monitoring system without building internal tooling

## Technical Requirements

You will need:

- A Postgres / Supabase database containing your product metrics

- Slack credentials for alerts

- Gmail credentials for email notifications

- (Optional) Notion credentials for incident documentation and daily reports

- An OpenAI / Anthropic API key for AI-based root cause analysis

## Workflow Steps
![image.png](fileId:3414)
The workflow is structured into four main sections:

1) Daily Revenue Health

Runs once per day, retrieves recent revenue metrics, identifies unusual spikes in churn MRR, and creates incidents when needed.
If an anomaly is detected, a Slack alert and email notification are sent immediately.

2) Daily Usage Health

Monitors feature usage metrics to detect sudden drops in adoption or engagement.
Incidents are logged with severity, context, and alerts to the product team.

3) Root Cause & Summary

For every open incident, the workflow:

Collects additional context from the database (e.g., churn by country or plan)

Uses AI to generate a clear root cause hypothesis and suggested next steps

Sends a summarized report to Slack and email

Updates the incident status accordingly

4) Daily Product Health Report

Every morning, the workflow compiles all incidents from the previous day into:

- A daily summary email for leadership

- A Notion page for documentation and historical tracking

- This ensures stakeholders have clear visibility into product performance trends.

## Key Features

- Automated anomaly detection across revenue and usage metrics

- Centralized incident logging with metadata and raw context

- Severity scoring based on deviation from historical baselines

- Slack and email alerts for fast response

- AI-generated root cause analysis with recommended actions

- Daily product health reporting for leadership and PM teams

- Optional Notion integration for incident documentation

- System logging for observability and auditability

- Fully modular: you can add more metrics, alert channels, or analysis steps easily

## Expected Output

- When running, the workflow will generate:

- Structured incident records in your database

- Slack alerts for revenue or usage anomalies

- Email notifications with severity, baseline vs actual, and context

- AI-generated root cause summaries

- A daily health report summarizing all incidents

- (Optional) Notion pages for both incidents and daily reports

- System logs recording successful executions

## Tutorial video:
[Watch the Youtube Tutorial video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JWHOyftEetA)


## About me

I‚Äôm Yassin a Project & Product Manager  Scaling tech products with data-driven project management.
üì¨ Feel free to connect with me on [Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/yassin-zehar)

workflow.name: Product Health Monitoring & Incident Management system final

parameters.query:
INSERT INTO incidents (
  metric_name,
  dimension,
  dimension_value,
  date_start,
  baseline_value,
  actual_value,
  delta_pct,
  severity,
  raw_context
)
VALUES (
  '{{$json.metric_name}}',
  'global',
  'all',
  '{{$json.date}}',
  {{$json.baseline_value}},
  {{$json.actual_value}},
  {{$json.delta_pct}},
  '{{$json.severity}}',
  '{{ JSON.stringify($json) }}'::jsonb
)
RETURNING incident_id;

parameters.content:
## How it works
This workflow monitors product health by automatically scanning key revenue and usage metrics, detecting anomalies, and alerting the team only when something looks wrong.

Every day, the system queries your Postgres (Supabase) database for recent product metrics (e.g. churn MRR, feature usage). A JavaScript step applies a simple statistical model (baseline window + z-score / delta %) to decide whether the latest value is abnormal compared to the last few days.

If no anomaly is detected, the workflow stops silently and nothing is sent ‚Äî no noise, no false alerts.

If an anomaly is detected, the workflow creates a structured incident in the incidents table (with metric name, baseline, actual value, delta %, severity and raw JSON context). It then sends a Slack alert and an email with all the key details so the product team can react quickly. Optionally, the incident can also be mirrored into a Notion database to keep a lightweight incident log for product documentation or postmortems.

Additional workflows can be plugged in on top of this foundation (e.g. root cause analysis, daily incident recap) by simply reading from the same incidents table.

## Setup steps:

- Configure your Postgres (Supabase) credentials in n8n and run the provided SQL script to create the core tables (accounts, revenue_events, product_usage_events, incidents, system_logs) and sample data.

- In the Postgres nodes, point the connection to your Supabase database and verify that a simple SELECT 1; query works.

- Add your Slack credentials (or bot token) in n8n and set the target channel for alerts (e.g. #product-health-alerts).

- Add your email credentials (Gmail or SMTP) and set the ‚ÄúFrom‚Äù and ‚ÄúTo‚Äù addresses for incident alerts.

- (Optional) Add your Notion integration token and database ID if you want each incident to also be logged as a Notion page.

- Configure your AI provider API key (OpenAI or compatible) if you plan to add an automated ‚Äúroot cause summary‚Äù workflow on top of this system.

- Adjust the cron triggers for the health checks (e.g. once per day in the morning) according to your monitoring needs.

- Run a test by forcing an anomaly (or inserting a fake incident) and confirm that:

- a row is created in the incidents table,

- the Slack alert is posted,

- the incident email is received, 

- and the optional Notion entry is created if configured.

## 1) Daily revenue health
Checks for MRR anomalies. Logs incident + notifies Product Team.

parameters.query:
SELECT
  date,
  active_accounts,
  accounts_viewing_dashboard,
  accounts_using_alerts
FROM daily_usage_metrics
WHERE date >= current_date - INTERVAL '30 days'
ORDER BY date;

INSERT INTO incidents (
  metric_name,
  dimension,
  dimension_value,
  date_start,
  date_end,
  baseline_value,
  actual_value,
  delta_pct,
  severity,
  raw_context
)
VALUES (
  $1, NULL, NULL, $2, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6, $7
)
RETURNING incident_id;

parameters.content:
## 2) Daily usage health
Monitors feature adoption. Detects unusual drops in usage patterns.

##  3) Root Cause & Summary
Enriches incidents with country/plan breakdown + AI-generated hypothesis.

parameters.query:
SELECT *
FROM incidents
WHERE status = 'open'
ORDER BY detected_at
LIMIT 1;

SELECT a.country, SUM(r.mrr_delta) AS churn_mrr
FROM revenue_events r
JOIN accounts a ON a.account_id = r.account_id
WHERE r.event_type = 'churn'
  AND r.event_date BETWEEN $1::date - INTERVAL '3 days'
                      AND $1::date
GROUP BY a.country
ORDER BY churn_mrr DESC;

SELECT a.plan, SUM(r.mrr_delta) AS churn_mrr
FROM revenue_events r
JOIN accounts a ON a.account_id = r.account_id
WHERE r.event_type = 'churn'
  AND r.event_date BETWEEN $1::date - INTERVAL '3 days'
                      AND $1::date
GROUP BY a.plan
ORDER BY churn_mrr DESC;

values.content:
=You are a Product Data & Revenue Analyst.

We detected an incident:
{{ $json.incident }}

Here is churn MRR by country (top offenders first):
{{ $json.churn_by_country }}

Here is churn MRR by plan:
{{ $json.churn_by_plan }}

1. Summarize what happened in simple business language.
2. Identify the most impacted segments (country, plan).
3. Propose 3-5 plausible hypotheses (product issues, price changes, bugs, market events).
4. Propose 3 concrete next steps for the Product team.

parameters.query:
UPDATE incidents 
SET status = 'analyzed',
    ai_summary = $1,
    updated_at = NOW()
WHERE incident_id = $2

parameters.content:
## 4) daily report
Generates daily global health report for leadership.

parameters.message:
=

üö® Product Health ‚Äì Anomaly Detected

Metric: {{$json.metric_name}}

Date: {{$json.date_start || $json.date}}

Severity: {{$json.severity}}

Baseline: {{$json.baseline_value}}

Actual: {{$json.actual_value}}

Delta (%): {{$json.delta_pct}}

This incident was logged in Supabase and synced to Notion.

‚Äî Product Health Bot
parameters.subject: =üö® Product Health Alert ‚Äì {{$json.metric_name}}

parameters.query:
INSERT INTO system_logs (workflow, status, message)
VALUES ($1, $2, $3)

options.queryReplacement: Daily revenue health, success, Incident logged and notifications sent

parameters.query:
SELECT
  date,
  new_mrr,
  churn_mrr,
  net_mrr_delta
FROM daily_revenue_metrics
WHERE date >= current_date - INTERVAL '30 days'
ORDER BY date;

INSERT INTO system_logs (workflow, status, message)
VALUES ($1, $2, $3);

options.queryReplacement: Root cause & summary, success, Root cause analysis generated ‚Äì summary sent to Product team

parameters.message:
=

üö® Usage Anomaly Detected

Metric: {{$json.metric_name}}

Severity: {{$json.severity}}

Baseline: {{$json.baseline_value}}

Actual: {{$json.actual_value}}

Delta: {{$json.delta_pct}}%

Logged in Supabase + synced to Notion.
parameters.subject: =üö® Usage Anomaly ‚Äì {{$json.metric_name}}

parameters.query:
INSERT INTO system_logs (workflow, status, message)
VALUES ($1, $2, $3);

options.queryReplacement: Daily usage health, success, Usage health check executed ‚Äì anomaly processed + notifications sent

parameters.query:
SELECT *
FROM incidents
WHERE detected_at::date = current_date - 1
ORDER BY detected_at;

INSERT INTO system_logs (workflow, status, message)
VALUES ($1, $2, $3);

options.queryReplacement: Daily report, success, Daily report executed ‚Äì email + Notion summary created

user.name: Yassin Zehar
user.bio: Product Manager | Data-oriented | Agile certified (PSM I, PSPO I)  | Paris

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
